events.originalText: U.S. Army soldier Robert Bales murdered sixteen civilians and wounded six others in Kandahar Province, Afghanistan.
events.subtitle: United States Army
events.headline: U.S. Army soldier Robert Bales murders sixteen civilians in Afghanistan

events.originalText: A massive earthquake and tsunami struck northeastern Japan and triggered a nuclear disaster at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant.
events.subtitle: 2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami
events.headline: Massive earthquake and tsunami hit Japan, triggering nuclear disaster

events.originalText: During the inauguration of Chilean president Sebastián Piñera, earthquakes registering 6.9 and 7.0 .mw-parser-output .tooltip-dotted{border-bottom:1px dotted;cursor:help}Mw struck the O'Higgins Region near the city of Pichilemu, causing widespread damage.
events.subtitle: Sebastián Piñera
events.headline: Chilean president Sebastián Piñera faces earthquakes during inauguration

events.originalText: A teenage gunman engaged in a shooting spree at a secondary school in Winnenden, Germany, killing 16, including himself.
events.subtitle: Winnenden school shooting
events.headline: Teenage gunman kills 16 in shooting spree at German school

events.originalText: Georgian authorities accused Russia of orchestrating a helicopter attack in the Kodori Valley of the breakaway territory of Abkhazia.
events.subtitle: 2007 Georgia helicopter incident
events.headline: Georgia accuses Russia of orchestrating helicopter attack in Abkhazia

events.originalText: Infosys became the first Indian-registered company to have its shares listed on Nasdaq.
events.subtitle: Infosys
events.headline: Infosys becomes first Indian company listed on Nasdaq

events.originalText: The U.S. Senate unanimously confirmed Janet Reno as the country's first female attorney general.
events.subtitle: United States Senate
events.headline: Janet Reno confirmed as first female U.S. attorney general

events.originalText: The anime film Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind by Hayao Miyazaki was released.
events.subtitle: Anime
events.headline: Hayao Miyazaki's Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind released

events.originalText: After hijacking a bus north of Tel Aviv, Israel, members of the Palestine Liberation Organization faction Fatah engaged in a shootout with police, resulting in the deaths of 38 civilians and most of the perpetrators.
events.subtitle: Coastal Road massacre
events.headline: Palestine Liberation Organization faction Fatah shootout in Israel kills 38 civilians

events.originalText: The Great Blizzard of 1888 struck the northeastern United States, producing snowdrifts in excess of 50 ft (15 m) and confining some people to their houses for up to a week.
events.subtitle: Great Blizzard of 1888
events.headline: Great Blizzard of 1888 hits northeastern United States

events.originalText: The Great Sheffield Flood killed at least 240 people and damaged more than 600 homes, after a crack in the Dale Dyke Dam caused it to fail.
events.subtitle: Great Sheffield Flood
events.headline: Great Sheffield Flood kills at least 240 people

events.originalText: Italian composer Giuseppe Verdi's opera Rigoletto premiered at La Fenice in Venice.
events.subtitle: Giuseppe Verdi
events.headline: Giuseppe Verdi's opera Rigoletto premieres in Venice

events.originalText: Māori forces, led by chiefs Te Ruki Kawiti and Hōne Heke, attacked the British settlement of Kororāreka, New Zealand, beginning the Flagstaff War.
events.subtitle: Māori people
events.headline: Māori forces attack British settlement in New Zealand, starting Flagstaff War

events.originalText: During a period of activity known as the Great Eruption, Eta Carinae (pictured) briefly became the second-brightest star in the night sky.
events.subtitle: Eta Carinae
events.headline: Eta Carinae becomes second-brightest star in night sky during Great Eruption

events.originalText: Queen Anne withheld royal assent from the Scottish Militia Bill, in the most recent veto by a British monarch of a bill that had been passed by Parliament.
events.subtitle: Anne, Queen of Great Britain
events.headline: Queen Anne withholds royal assent from Scottish Militia Bill

events.originalText: Mount Etna in Sicily began erupting, eventually producing the largest lava flow in the volcano's history, and damaging Catania and other towns.
events.subtitle: Mount Etna
events.headline: Mount Etna erupts, causing largest lava flow in history
